content:
alexcrichton opened PR #12124 from alexcrichton:less-trigger to bytecodealliance:main:

Every time I add labels to issues I routinely get emails about cancelled workflows. I'm kind of tired of getting these emails so let's try moving to just a cron for this workflow.

<!--
Please make sure you include the following information:

  • If this work has been discussed elsewhere, please include a link to that
    conversation. If it was discussed in an issue, just mention "issue #...".

  • Explain why this change is needed. If the details are in an issue already,
    this can be brief.

Our development process is documented in the Wasmtime book:
https://docs.wasmtime.dev/contributing-development-process.html

Please ensure all communication follows the code of conduct:
https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasmtime/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
-->
alexcrichton has marked PR #12124 as ready for review.

fitzgen submitted PR review:

Wait does this mean we won't do label-messager or subscribe-to-label for issues anymore?

alexcrichton commented on PR #12124:

My impression was that would still happen via the cron workflow, but I might also misunderstand the other actions in play here. Currently though only one labeler workflow can run so if you add tags to 2 issues the one run gets cancelled, so if it requires the per-tag-run we're already losing a lot.

fitzgen submitted PR review:

Okay, we will see if our labeling just stops working, I guess.
